flawed_nl_solution:
If there were beacon towers every 5 kilometers along the 7300 kilometer length of the Great Wall, then there were 7300/5=<<7300/5=1640>>1640 beacon towers.
If every tower had 2 soldiers, then there were a total of 1640*2=<<1640*2=3280>>3280 soldiers in beacon towers along the Great Wall.
#### 3280

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1460, not 1640. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
